<p>Downloaded by Birosoft Enterprises (<a href="mailto:birosoftenterprises@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">birosoftenterprises@gmail.com</a>)</p>
<p>UNIT TWO: RESEARCH PROPOSAL DEVELOPMENT</p>
<p>Proposal - Is a document which details an intended activity e.g. a research or project</p>
<ul>
<li>Once a proposal has been accepted by an institution, or a funding agency, the writer of the proposal is obliged to follow the steps outlined in the proposal.</li>
<li>A proposal demonstrates the researcherâ€™s ability to think clearly about the intended research or project</li>
<li>It should be straight forward document, uncluttered with extraneous and irrelevant information</li>
<li>It should also be clearly organized, simple and presented in a logical form</li>
<li>The researcher proposes to undertake a piece of research on some pertinent issue</li>
<li>Research proposals may be academic oriented but are still aimed at undertaking research to solve a problem. i.e. action oriented research</li>
<li>Though most components found in an academic research proposal would also be relevant in one which is not, some section may not be relevant and could be left out without affecting the quality of the proposal e.g. not all action oriented research proposals will require hypotheses or theoretical backgrounds</li>
</ul>
<p>2.1 Components and sections of a research proposal</p>
<p>FORMAT OF MAIN BODY Each chapter e.g. Chapter One:-INTRODUCTION should start on a separate page.</p>
<p>CHAPTER ONE INTRODUCTION</p>
<p>This chapter should include the following;</p>
<p>1.1 Background Information:</p>
<ul>
<li>Should show understanding and genesis of the problem.</li>
<li>Gives specific gaps that are considered to be the root of the problem.</li>
<li>This should be maximum one and half pages</li>
</ul>
<p>This document is available on
studocu
Downloaded by Birosoft Enterprises (<a href="mailto:birosoftenterprises@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">birosoftenterprises@gmail.com</a>)</p>
<p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">âœ“</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">âœ“</span></span></span></span></span> Talk about the global perspective followed by the local scenario.</p>
<p>1.2 Statement of the problem:-
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">âœ“</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">âœ“</span></span></span></span></span> Must indicate exactly what the problem is.
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">âœ“</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">âœ“</span></span></span></span></span> Indicate why and how it is a problem. Give information to support this e.g. by use of statistics
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">âœ“</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">âœ“</span></span></span></span></span> This should be derived from background information to illustrate connectivity.
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">âœ“</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\checkmark</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6922em;"></span><span class="mord amsrm">âœ“</span></span></span></span></span> Length- Maximum 2 paragraphs.</p>
<p>1.3 Justification of the study Should illustrate why the researcher is conducting the research and whom it shall benefit</p>
<p>1.4 Objectives:-
1.4.1 General/Broad Objective - One general objective which should be in line with the title.
1.4.2 Specific objectives</p>
<ul>
<li>have to be in line with the variables the candidates hypothesize to influence the phenomenon being investigated.</li>
<li>Should be related to the general objective.</li>
<li>Should be â€œSMARTâ€</li>
</ul>
<p>1.5 Research Questions:-</p>
<ul>
<li>They should be in line with the specific objectives and equal in number.</li>
<li>Have to be numbered (1, 2, 3...) and should be questions and not statements. . Note:</li>
<li>Paragraphing should be consistent. Either leave space or indent between paragraphs.</li>
<li>Spacing and indenting should not be used together.</li>
<li>One sentence paragraphs are unacceptable.</li>
<li>A paragraph should have a minimum of five sentences.</li>
</ul>
<p>1.6 Hypotheses: Where applicable</p>
<p>1.7 Conceptual/Theoretical Framework (where applicable). Some studies especially laboratory oriented may not fit into Conceptual/Theoretical frames). Where applicable it gives conceptualized view of the study problem. If a certain theory fits into the study, it should be indicated and discussed.</p>
<p>2.0 CHAPTER TWO LITERATURE REVIEW
The student should demonstrate evidence of understanding of current research on the subject under investigation and show clear gaps in knowledge that will be discussed. Relevant themes to the study and derived review should be consistent with the requirements of the title Review the empirical and theoretical literature relevant to the problem being investigated showing clearly the linkage of literature review to the research questions.</p>
<p>Downloaded by Birosoft Enterprises (<a href="mailto:birosoftenterprises@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">birosoftenterprises@gmail.com</a>)</p>
<p>âœ“ Indicate what has been done by other researchers including the methodologies used and identify gaps.
âœ“ Cite 3-5 references per key section in the text.
âœ“ Harvard method of citation. Consistency is important in citation.
âœ“ Each key variable should be 2-3 pages long.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="3-0-chapter-three-materials-and-methods">3.0 CHAPTER THREE MATERIALS AND METHODS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-0-chapter-three-materials-and-methods" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This Chapter highlights methodological details appropriate to the study. This chapter should include:</p>
<p>3.1 Study Site State where the study will be done (location) and why it was chosen
3.2 Study design- State and justify the chosen design
3.3 Study Variables. Explain the independent and dependent variables
3.4 Study Population - Clearly identify and describe the study population. Describing specifically who will be part of the study. (Occasionally "target population" may be mentioned)
3.4.1 Inclusion
3.4.2 Exclusion Criteria
3.5 Sample Size Determination Describe how the sample size will be computed
3.6 Sampling techniques- Provide description of the technique
3.7 Data collections tools (if any) Explain the tool that will be used in the study and how they will be constructed
3.8 Pre-Testing of data collection tools (if any)</p>
<ul>
<li>Describe how data will be collected and how pretesting centres will be selected). It is here that the following issues will be discussed:</li>
</ul>
<p>(i) Validity- Explain how validity of the instruments will be established
(ii) Reliability- Show and explain how reliability of the instruments will be established N.B. If using standardized test, quote test and existing validity and reliability levels</p>
<p>3.9 Data Collection Explain how field or laboratory data collection will be done
3.10 Data Management and analysis Explain the methods that will be applied in analyzing the data after field or laboratory work
3.11 Ethical Considerations</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="references">REFERENCES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#references" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>References listed alphabetically in the reference list. For citation within the text the format of author and year of publication (Harvard of APA format are recommended) No numbering</p>

<p>QUALITIES OF A GOOD RESEARCH PROPOSAL</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="identifying-research-problems">Identifying Research Problems<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#identifying-research-problems" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="steps">Steps<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#steps" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>i. Identify the broad area of interest</p>
<ul>
<li>The area should be relevant to the profession and goals of the researcher e.g. HIV/AIDS, TB, malaria, FP, breastfeeding</li>
</ul>
<p>ii. Identify a specific problem within broad area e.g. in HIV/AIDS</p>
<ul>
<li>Prevention of new infections</li>
<li>Circumcision</li>
<li>Needle prick injuries to nurses</li>
<li>Breastfeeding or not of infected</li>
<li>Management (HAART/ARV Rx)</li>
<li>Compliance</li>
<li>HAART in mother to child transmission</li>
<li>Health workers handling</li>
<li>Perceptions</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="3-3-2-what-is-a-researchable-problem">3.3.2 What is a Researchable problem?<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-3-2-what-is-a-researchable-problem" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>It should be an important problem i.e.</p>
<p>i. Lead to findings that have wide spread implication to a particular area
ii. Challenge some commonly held altruism
iii. Reviews the inadequacies of existing laws, policies, theories, views e.t.c.
iv. Cover a reasonable scope i.e. not too narrow or general</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="3-3-3-certain-factors-determine-the-scope-of-a-research-study">3.3.3 Certain factors determine the scope of a research study<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-3-3-certain-factors-determine-the-scope-of-a-research-study" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>These factors include:</p>
<p>i. The time available to carry it out
ii. The money available to carry out-type print and bind reports
iii. The availability of equipments needed to carry out the research
iv. The availability of subjects or units of study</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="3-3-4-ways-of-identifying-a-specific-research-problem">3.3.4 Ways of identifying a specific research problem<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-3-4-ways-of-identifying-a-specific-research-problem" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>A research problem can be identified by several ways from the broad area</p>
<p>Downloaded by Birosoft Enterprises (<a href="mailto:birosoftenterprises@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">birosoftenterprises@gmail.com</a>)</p>
<p>a) Existing literature
âœ“ By doing systematic reading of broad area of interest. This gives a good background of the basic information and insight into various issues that could be studied</p>
<p>b) Existing theories
âœ“ Existing theories in an area contain generalization and hypotheses and principles which can be scientifically tested
âœ“ This leads to validation or otherwise invalidate of an existing generalization or principles</p>
<p>c) Discussion with experts
âœ“ Discussion with subject authorities in seminars, class, workshop, conferences e.t.c. are a source of current problems that could be researched include experienced researchers</p>
<p>d) Replication
âœ“ This involves carrying out a research that has been done previously
âœ“ The problem and methods are identical to the previous study</p>
<p>e) Previous research studies
âœ“ These usually indicate areas of further research or knowledge gaps in previous studies
âœ“ This helps in building up knowledge from previous researchers</p>
<p>f) Media
âœ“ Frequently reported issues in the media can form the basis of research problem such issues are usually discussed in a public and hence important to majority</p>
<p>Examples
âœ“ Prostitutions-discordant couples, HIV/AIDS orphans, both injuries related to fuel tanker accidents, husband battering, drug peddling and abuse e.t.c.</p>
<p>g) Personal experiences
âœ“ First hand observations and reflection experiences could be sources of research problems ie. Experiences usually lead and vivid images, a hunch or an intuition on the part of a serious researcher e.g</p>
<p>This document is available on
5
studocu
Downloaded by Birosoft Enterprises (<a href="mailto:birosoftenterprises@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">birosoftenterprises@gmail.com</a>)</p>
<p>Post surgical infections, maternal death, and neonatal death</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="3-3-5-stating-the-problem">3.3.5 Stating the problem<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-3-5-stating-the-problem" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The researcher usually starts with a brief introductory section of the general study area. Then the researcher narrows down to the specific area of study</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="3-3-6-characteristics-of-a-good-problem-statement">3.3.6 Characteristics of a good problem statement<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-3-6-characteristics-of-a-good-problem-statement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>i. It is clearly written that it captures the readers' interest
ii. Should be objectively researchable
iii. It indicates the scope of the specific research
iv. The significance of the study is clearly stated i.e. how study will add new knowledge
v. The problem statement must give the purpose of the research</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="stating-the-purpose-broad-objective">Stating the purpose/Broad objective<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#stating-the-purpose-broad-objective" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>It conveys the focus of the study in one or two sentences</li>
<li>The purpose families why the study is being done</li>
<li>It crystallizes the researchers inquiry into a particular field</li>
<li>It accurately expressed, the rest of the research process will be easy</li>
</ul>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="criteria-for-a-good-purpose-statement">Criteria for a good purpose statement<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#criteria-for-a-good-purpose-statement" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>i. Be clear, unambiguously and a declarative manner
ii. Should indicate concepts or variables in the study
iii. The relationship between variables should be stated where possible
iv. Should state the target population
v. The variables and the target population in the purpose should be consistent with the variables and target population operationalized in the method section of the study</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="examples">Examples<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#examples" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ul>
<li>The purpose of this study is to investigate breastfeeding purposes/practices among the professionals in Mombasa</li>
</ul>
<p>Downloaded by Birosoft Enterprises (<a href="mailto:birosoftenterprises@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">birosoftenterprises@gmail.com</a>)</p>
<p>âœ“ The purpose of this is to find out the relationship between male circumcision and HIV infection prevalence/incidences in Nyanza province
âœ“ The purpose of this study is to compare the effects of three types of cattle feed on the productivity of milk in cows
âœ“ The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of alcohol on reaction time of heavy truck drivers in Kenya</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="nb-the-purpose-should-not-be-stated-in-biased-or-subjective-verbs-sentences">NB-The purpose should not be stated in biased or subjective verbs/sentences<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#nb-the-purpose-should-not-be-stated-in-biased-or-subjective-verbs-sentences" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>BIASED</th><th></th><th>NEUTRAL</th><th></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>-Show</td><td>-indicate</td><td>-Determine</td><td>-Find out</td></tr><tr><td>-Prove</td><td>-Validate</td><td>-Compare</td><td>-Examine</td></tr><tr><td>-Confirm</td><td>-Explain</td><td>-Explore</td><td>-Inquire</td></tr><tr><td>-Verify</td><td>-Illustrate</td><td>-Investigate</td><td>-Test</td></tr><tr><td>-Check</td><td></td><td>-Differentiate</td><td>-Establish</td></tr><tr><td>-Demonstrate</td><td></td><td></td><td></td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="stating-the-specific-objective">Stating the specific objective<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#stating-the-specific-objective" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>âœ“ These are specific issues within the scope of stated purpose
âœ“ These helps the researcher to keep the scope of the study by defining area of knowledge that the researcher is focusing on
âœ“ Neutral verbs or phrases are applicable also here</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="examples">Examples<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#examples" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="purpose">Purpose<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#purpose" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>âœ“ The purpose of this study is to investigate the breastfeeding practices among professionals in Mombasa district</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="specific-objectives">Specific objectives<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#specific-objectives" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
